comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: New York area marksman C.B. Winder - Winner of the Leech Cup match held in Sea Girt, New Jersey, in 1903 - mentioned in a New York Times article as Captain C.B. Winder - query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9906E6D71230E132A...

comment.author: 10754903@N07
comment._content: The rifle is the 1905 version of the 1903 Springfield.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
1911 photo, probably taken at the National Military marksmanship contests at Camp Perry, Ohio. This was the fifth year in a row that the contests had been held at Camp Perry. 

Colonel A. C. Sharpe was at Camp Perry also:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163520728/in/photostream/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162719777/]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton: Thank you for the information about Winder.  We will add some of it to the record when we update.
